titleStmt.title: Copy entries in Volume 2 of Arber’s transcript of the Stationers' Register
titleStmt.funder: This transcript was funded by an Oxford University Lyell Fund award

sourceDesc.ab: Transcriptions and encodings made from an electronic facsmile of Arber, Edward, A Transcript of the Registers of the Company of Stationers 1554-1640 AD, 5 vols, (London: Priv. Print,; 1875-77, & Birmingham, 1875-94), Butler Library, Columbia University in the City of New York, R015.42 L8a http://clio.cul.columbia.edu:7018/vwebv/holdingsInfo?bibId=6177070

projectDesc.p: Created by the Stationers’ Register Online project (http://http://digital.humanities.ox.ac.uk/ProjectProfile/Project_page.aspx?pid=307)

revisionDesc.change: Material other than copy entries removed by Giles Bergel

Semi-automated changes based on bodleian proofreading made to the SRO data after the initial conversion (and up-conversion of roman numerals, fees, dates, names, etc.) from abbreviated tei-corset schema by James Cummings
Encoding reviewed, with suggestions made for improvements, a random sample of names checked, and spot-proofed by Pip Willcox. December 2012 - May 2013.

1594 i. e. 10–17 March 1595
Anno 37° Regni Reginae Elizabeth[æ]/

div.head:
This belongeth to the 318 leafe. /
Master Watkins. master.
Master Cawood
Master Binge
Wardens/
Thomas Creede . /.
div.p:
Entred for his Copie under the h]andes of bothe the wardens a booke entituled Mother redd cappe her laste will and Testament conteyning sundrye conceipted and pleasant tales furnished with moche varyetie to move Delighte
vjd
. /.

div.head: Thomas Creede . /.
div.p:
Entred alsoe for his Copie vnder the wardens handes likewise a booke called Pheander the mayden knight&c vjd
. /.

div.head: Thomas Gosson .
div.p:
Entred for his copie vnder the wardens handes Newes from Rome, Venice, and Vienna touchinge the procedinges of the Turke against the Christians in Austria Hungarie and Helvetia
vjd

div.head: John Danter . /.
div.p:
Entred for his Copie vnder the h]andes of bothe the wardens a ballad entituIed the madd merye pranckes of Long Megg of Westminster
vjd
. /.

div.head: William Jones /
div.p:
Entred for his Copie vnder the h]andes of bothe the wardens a booke entituled the schoole of good manners vjd
. /.

Entred for his copie vnder the wardens hande a ballad intituled, the second parte of the merchantes Daughter of Bristowe
vjd

div.head: Thomas Salis­bury . /.
div.p:
Entred for his Copie vnder the h]andes of bothe the wardens the perpetuitye of faythe wrytten in latine by master Doctour Some and nowe translated into Englishe and soe to be printed vjd
. /

div.head: Raphe Jackson .
div.p:
Entred vnto him under the h]andes of the late Busshop of London
John Aylmer
and nowe deceased, and the nowe wardens, A booke entituled That the Scriptures or written woorde, is only GODs woord, and not traditions, Or a comparicon betwene the truthe nowe taught in England and ye doctrine of the Romishe Churche with a brief Confutacon of that popishe doctrine. by Ffrauncis Bonney
Sommetyme fellowe of Magdalem Colledge in Oxon vjd

Entred for his Copie vnder the wardens handes / a most strange and myraculous wonder of a golden Chayer that was found in the sea neere the Isle of Jarsey, and of the filthie murder of 8 persons that proceaded thereof vjd
Entred for his copie vnder the wardens handes, a newe Northeren songe, intituled for the love of our towne, call in our alley soone vjd

div.head:
master Cawood
vpper warden /
div.p: Entred for his copie, in full courte / a booke intituled / La nobilta del L’asino, di Attabalippa dal Peru Prouincia del Mondo novo. to be translated into Englishe vjd
Entred for his copie in full courte a booke intituled, the absolute souldier or the pollicie of armes vjd

fw.seg:
G. Cawood .
I. Binge .
R. Watkins .

div.head: Edward Aggas /
div.p: Entred for his Copie vnder the h]andes of bothe the wardens a booko entituled a godly and learned treatise declaring the waye and meanes to attayne vnto the very staye and perfect quietnes of the mynde &c vjd . / .

div.head: Cutbert Burbye /
div.p: Entred for his copie under the wardens handes an Enterlude called the Pynder of Wakefeilde vjd
Entred for his Copie vnder the handes of the Wardens. A booke entituled, The pensive mans Complaint and comforte. The second parte of the pensive mans practice &c vjd

div.head: Clement Knight /
div.p:
Entred for his copie vnder the wardens handes a booke intituled / A figge for
Momus / vjd
C. Knight was not translated from the Drapers’ Company till the 3rd June 1600, see p. 725.

div.head: Master Cawood /
div.p:
Entred for his Copie a booke entituled Saincte
Peters
Complainte with
Mary Magdalen
s blusshe and her Complaint at
Christ
es deathe ,] with other poemes / Master Binges hande beinge at it. Master Hartwelles hande was likewise at the Copie. / vjd

div.head: Thomas Gosson . /
div.p: Entred for his Copie vnder the h]andes of bothe the wardens a booke entituled Lamentable newes from Cesillia Sicilly a Island of the spanishe kinges which lately was assayled and spoyled in sundrie places by the Turkishe gallies beinge 107 sayle vjd . / .

div.head: Abell Jeffes . /
div.p:
Entred for his Copie vnder the h]andes of bothe the wardens a booke entituled Sainct Peters
teares vjd .

div.head: Henrie Osney . /
div.p: Entred for his Copie vnder the h]andes of the Wardens a booke entituled an Apologie for Poetrie vjd
This belongeth to master ponsonby by a former entrance And an agrement is made between them whereby Master Ponsonby is to enjoy the copie according to the former entrance

The first entry to W. Ponsonby of this work by Sir
Philip Sidney
was on the 29th November 1594, see p. 666.

div.head: Roger warde .
div.p: Entred for his Copie vnder the h]andes of the Wardens a brief note of the benefites that growe to this Realme by the observacon of fishedayes &c vjd

div.head: John Busbye .
div.p: Entred for his Copie vnder the handes of the Wardens. A booke entituled Endimion and Phebæ . vjd
Entred for his Copie. a booke of verie pythie similies Comfortable and profitable for all men to reade vjd

Entred for his Copie vnder the h]andes of bothe the wardens a booke entituled Raptus
Helenæ
,] Helen
s Rape by the Athenian Duke
Theseus
vjd . / .
Entred for his Copie vnder the h]andes of bothe the wardens a booke or interlude intituled a pleasant Conceipte called the owlde wifes tale vjd . / .

div.head: Thomas Man . /.
div.p: Entred for his Copie vnder the h]andes of bothe the wardens a booke entituled the Rowsinge of the sluggerde vjd / .

div.head: Thomas Millington /
div.p: Entred for his Copie vnder the h]ande of Master Warden Binge a ballad entituled a warninge to England with speede to Repente for the greate scarssetye and want that now is and like this yeare ensuinge to be &c / Provided that before the printinge thereof he get Master Cawoodes hande for further warraunt. vjd . /

div.head: John Legatt .
div.p: Entred vnto him for his Copie vnder the handes of the Wardens. An exposition of the Symbole or Creede of the Apostles, accordinge to the tenour of the Scriptures, and the Consent of Orthodoxe fathers of the Churche vjd

Entred for his copie a booke intituled a Garland for a grene Wytt vjd

vjd

and

div.head: Raffe Hancock .
div.p: Entred for his copie vnder the handes of the Wardens. Phillips his gigg of the slyppers vjd

Entred for their copie vnder the h]andes of the wardens. A Reporte of a monster borne at Ottimgham in holdernes. the
ixth of Aprill 1595 / alsoe of a strange and hughe fishe dryven on the Sandes at Onthonie in holdernes in ffebruarye before vjd

div.head: Richard Jones /
div.p: Entred for his copie vnder both the wardens handes. Certen questions concerninge Conny-hood, and the qualitie of the Conny / of which vnder the moderatorship of Honny mouth stengler, Conny catcher, merry pate, the knave of Clubbes beinge Answerer vjd

Entred for his copie vnder the wardens handes a ballad intituled. the poore Saylers praise of the parson of Twe in Cornwall, who feedethe the hungrie, helpeth the sick, Cureth the hurte &c beinge vnder bothe the wardens handes vjd

div.head: william Jones /
div.p: Entred for his copie vnder the handes of master Judson and the wardens / Twoo Sermons of master Greeneham The one, vppon the first verse of the 22 Chapter of the Proverbes / The other vppon the xixth verse of the 3 Chapter to the Thessolonians vjd

div.head: Edwarde White /
div.p:
Entred for his copie vnder the handes of the wardens, a Seamans coragious welcome to the Soldiers prepared for the voyage of Sir

and Sir

Knightes vjd

XXXVIJ. /

div.p:
Entred for their Copie vnder the h]andes of the lorde Arch Bisshop of Canterbury his grace and the wardens a booke entituled An answere vnto a certein Calumnious letter published by Master
Job Throkmorton
and entituled ‘a defense of J: Throkmorton
against the sclaunders of Master
Sutcliffe /’ wherein the vanytie bothe of the defence of him self and the accusation of others is manifestly declared by
Mathew Sutcliffe . /. vjd
Assigned ouer vnto him from Richard Jones by consent of the wardens and a Court holden this daye: A booke Intituled the English Secretary vjd

Entred for his copie vnder th e h]andes of the Wardens and in full Court holden this daye. A booke to be translated into English. Called Chiromantre done in latyn by John Rothman Phisician and philosopher vjd

div.head: John Wolfe /
div.p:
Entred for his Copie vnder bothe the Wardens handes, a booke intituled Lycanthropia, or
Cupid
s Phrensie vjd
The End of the Entrances of Copies.

his wife and
Tharsa
his Daughter viijd
This booke is sett foorth in print with this title The patterne of peynfull aduentures.

div.p: Whereas there is one booke newlie compiled to be printed Intituled, as foloweth viz. An abstract of all the penall statutes whiche be generall in force and use wherein is conteyned the effect of all those statutes which Doo threaten to the offenders thereof, the Losse of Lyfe. member. Landes. goodes or other punishement or forfaiture whatsoeuer.

p.title: Whereunto is also added in their apt titles th

The said booke and theimprintinge thereof ys Lycensed and graunted, to Richard Tottell . Raffe Newberie . and Robert walley . successivelie in forme folowinge viz
ffirst to the said Richard Tottell for terme of his naturall Lyfe.
And then from the Decease of the saide Richard Tottell . to the sayd Raffe Newberie for terme of his naturall life.

And from the Decease of the said Raffe Newberie then to the said Robert Wallie for terme of his naturall Lyfe.

div.p: Alwaies provided that the said henry bynneman shall from tyme to tyme accordinge to his good discretion chose and accept any fyve of this cumpanie to be parteners with him in the Imprintinge of these bookes

div.p: It is very noticeable that within about a week some 180 ballads were licensed or rather brought under the official cognizance of the Wardens. Of course, most of them were printed a long time before; and there must have been some strong reason occasioning their now being entered, re-entered, or filed at Stationers’ Hall.]

It is evident from the fee that most of these ballads had been previously licensed.]
These ballades are menconed in a bill of Ric Jones his own wrytinge filed vp with the ballades
It is a pity that the Clerk did not preserve a copy of R. Jones’ list in this Register.

div.head: Thomas Purfoote /
div.p:
Allowed vnto Thomas Purfoote the ymprintinge of the Briefes of all letters Patentes to be graunted vnder the greate seale of England for gatheringe by reason of Casualtyes and losses. happenynge as well by sea as by Land. and master Denham
iiijd

no sum stated
Alowed vnto him for his copye A most ferefull sight lately seene in Ffraunce which appered in ye Aire ouer the town of Landersi. Aucthorised vnder the Bishop of Londons hand vjd

div.head:
John Porter
Thomas Gubbyn /
div.p:
Alowed vnto him for his Copye a Booke intytuled Three Treatises necessarye to be Considered of all Christians, Allowed vnder the Bishop of London
s hand] vjd

div.head: John wolf .
div.p:
Alowed vnto him for his copie, psalmes of Invocation vpon GOD to preserue her Maiestie and the people of this Land from the power of our enemies. gathered by christofer Stile . And alowed vnder master Gravettes hand
no sum stated
Receaued of him for a booke of Sir philip Sidneys makinge intitled Arcadia: aucthorised vnder the Archbishop of Canterbury his hand vjd
Item Receaued of him for A translation of Salust De Bartas . Done by ye same Sir P. in the Englishe vjd

div.head: Richard Hudson . /
div.p:
Alowed vnto him for his Copie a booke intytuled certen Englishe verses presented to the Quenes moste excellent maiestie in the parke of Sainct James, on Sundaye the 18th of Auguste 1588. Vppon Condicon that yt shall and maye be Lycenced hereafter vjd
d [ebens] . /

Alowed vnto him for his Copie a br
e
ife Treatise discoveringe in substance the offences and vngodlie practises of the late 14 Tragtours Condempned the
xxvjth of Auguste 1588. Withe the manner of the execucon of viij of them on the 28th of Auguste 1588. Allowed vnder Doctor Stallard hande
no sum stated

div.head: John Wolf . /
div.p:
Alowed vnto him for hia Copie A propper newe balled briefely shewinge the honorable Cumpanyes of horsmen and footemen whiche diverse nobles of Englande brought before her maiestie &c Withe Condicon that yt maie be lycenced hereafter
no sum stated

div.head: John wolf .
div.p:
Allowed vnto him for his copie, a booke intituled. Twoo speciall treatises, the one, teachings everye Christian howe to trye and examyne himself, the other intreatinge of GODs Devyne prouidence withe certen Sermons of Doctor Baro , Allowed vnder the h]andes of master Hartwell and master warden Coldock
no sum stated

a faict assembler au port de La Ville de Lisbonne au Rayaume de Portugall en l’an 1588. contre L’armee Angloise
Item, Auscuns Articles proposez par les chefs de la ligue en l’assemblee De Nancye en Januier 1588 pour estre arrestez en la generalle de Mars prochain

Item Discours sur l’estate de Ffrance Avec la Copie de Lettres patentes du Roy depuis quil s’est Retire de Paris, Ensemble la copie De Deux Lettres De Duo De Guyze

for

div.head: John Wolf . /
div.p:
Alowed vnto him for his Copie the martiall shewes of horsemen before her maiestie at Sainct James Aucthorised vnder master Gravettes hande

Alowed to him vnder Doctor STALLERDes hand Distichon Coloniensin Anglis Hispanorum nigum minitant in &c

div.head: John wolf .
div.p:

no sum stated
beinge nowe allowed vnder the h]andes of master Hartwell and master warden coldock . /

Entred for his Copie a booke aucthorised vnder master Gravetes hand beinge Twoo frutefull exercises. theone beinge a discourse vpon the 16. and 17. verses of the 16 Chapter of the book of Judges and theother vppon the 41. and 42. verses of the 10 chapter of Sainct
Luke By E R vjd
Master Coldockes hand beinge to it /

Allowed vnto him for his copie a booke of Doctor Gentilis , Intituled De Jure Belli Commentatio vnder the h]andes of master Hartwell and master warden Coldock

div.head: Henry kirkham .
div.p: Entred for him vpon condicon it may be allowed; A Ballad of thankes gyvinge vnto GOD, for his mercy toward hir maiestie begynnynge Reioyce England beinge certefied to be alowable vnder Doctor Stallerdes hand vjd . d [ebens] .

div.head: Edward Aggas /
div.p:
Entred vnto him for his Copie a ballad aucthorised vnder the hande of the Bisshop of London and entituled Ramsies

e
erle of
Leicester
whiche departed this worlde at Cornburye the
iiijth of September 1588. / vjd

div.head: John woulfe . /
div.p:
Allowed vnto him theis bokes followinge to be prynted, that is to saye, The popes bull in Dutche with the answere thereto to be translated, and that noe person shall prynte any parte or parcell thereof to his hindrance, authorised vnder the Lord Threasurers i. e. Lord Burghley
hand and bothe the wardens
no sum stated

Allowed vnto him for his Copye, a books intytuled, the Coronation of

div.head: John Bowen . /
div.p: Allowed vnto him for his Copye, a Catechisme conteyninge summarylie the chief poyntes of christyan Religion made Dyologue wyse by brief questyons and answeres, wrytten by Patryck gallowaye and aucthorysed vnder the h]andes of Doctor Staller , and bothe the wardens vjd . / d [ebens]
The said Catechisme was vsed by the said Patryck Gallowaye in the famylie of the Scottishe noblemen then resident at Newcastle. /

div.p:
Allowed vnto him for his copye, a booke intytuled, the blessednes of Brytayne vnder master warden Coldockes hand

Allowed vnto him, The wholle su
i
te of Mowldes belonginge to the olde / fourme of plaieinge Cardes commonlie called the Ffrenche Carde / Entred. by warrant from master warden coldocke vjd
with the Jew Cisian Dozen and all other thinges therevnto belonging /

div.head: master Raphe Bowes Esquier See p. 509.
div.p:

i
te of newe mouldes belonginge to the olde and newe forme of playeinge Cardes commmonlie called the Ffrenche Carde. with the Jew Cisian Dozen and all other thinges therevnto belonginge vjd

Bernardin Di Mendozza , with th
e
advertisementes out of Ireland, in the Italyan tongue, by warrant of a letter from Sir ffrauncis walsingham to the master and wardens of the Cumpanye. Dated the xviijth of this october. 1588

Richard Jones
Edward white
Thomas Orwin
Henrye Carre /

e
age of lx. yeres in the middest of whose forehead by the wonderfull woorke of GOD, there groweth out a Croked horne of 4 ynches louge / Allowed vnder Doctor Hetons hand. and entred by warrant from master warden Coldock

Here is a book registered for publication before the event which it described, happened.]

Master Harryson
theelder. /

div.head: Thomas Orwyn . / this is allowed by the consent of the whole table. as it is here sett downe. /
div.p: Entred for his Copye, a booke intytuled The wrytinge Schoolemayster, Conteyning Three bookes in one, The firste, teachinge swyfte wrytinge, the second true wrytinge and the third, faire wryinge, the firste booke entytuled the Arte of Brachygraphis. / the second booke named the order of Orthographie / and the third booke is the key of Calligraphie. Inuented by Peter Bales . Aucthorysed vnder the h]andes of master Hartwell and bothe the wardens/ Provyded ALWAYES that yf this boke belonge to any other of the Companye, Then this entrance to be voyd. / and it is allowed by my Lord grace of Canterberye with master Hartwell es hand to yt vjd . /

div.head: master Harrison Theelder [See p. 541
div.p:
Entred for his copie a treatise named. Lucar solace, devided into iiij bookes. which in parte are Collected out of Diuerse Aucthours into Diuerse Languages, and in parte Devised by
Ciprian lucar
no sum stated

Entred for his Copic, A ballad entituled, A pleasant newe ballad wherein is discryde howe Three persons for Lechery through London did ryde. / Entred vnder the h]andes of Doctour Staller , and master warden Newberyes hand to it vjd

div.head: Richard ffeild /
div.p: Lycecnced vnto him vnder the h]andes of master Doctor Stallard and bothe the wardens, a booke intituled a Sovereigne salue for a sicke Soule / teachinge the righte vse of a patient bearinge the crosse vjd

div.head: Richard ffeild /
div.p:
Lycenced vnto him vnder the Bishop of London hande / a booke intituled / A brief discourse dialoge wise shewinge howe false and dangerous their reportes are which affirme the Spanyardes intendid invasion is for r
e
establishment of the romishe Religion. / her maiesties allyance with ye Netherlanders / &c and Sir
ffrancis Drakes
enterprise three yeres past into the West Indies vjd
Entred for his copie: The weddinge garment. Aucthorised vnder master Hartwelles hand and master newberies beinge to yt also vjd solutum

div.head: William wrighte /
div.p:
Entred vnto him for his copie vnto the h]andes of the Bishop of London and master warden Newberye . The Travelles of
Edward webbe
vjd R . / solutum

div.head: John wolf /
div.p:
Entered for his copie vnder master Hartwelles handes and master Newberies
a songe of the Frenche kinges vyctorie the 14 of marche 1590 vjd / R . solutum

Entred for their copie vnder the Byshop of londons hand: master Cawoodes also beinge to yt: A book entitled Come and behold howe
Christ
shyneth before the lawe, in the Lawe, and in the prophetes vjd

a

æ 32do/

div.p: Entred for his Copie, A ballad intytuled A brave encouragement for Englishe Chivalrye &c vnder the h]ande of the Bisshop of London , and bothe the Wardens handes beinge to yt vjd

div.head: william wrighte /
div.p:
Entred for his copie vnder the h]andes of master Gravet
and master warden Newberye , A Mournefull dyltie on the deathe of certen Judges and Justices of the peace and diuerse other gentlement whoo dyed ymcdiatclie after the assises holden at Lyncolne laste paste vjd R / solutum

div.head: Thomas nelson . /
div.p: Entered for his copye, a ballade intytuled, a newe Scottyshe sonnett made betwene a kynge and his love, vnder the h]andes of Doctor Staller and master Cawood warden vjd . /

master George
Byshop. /

Entred for his copie vnder master HARTWELLes hand and the wardens to be printed in Latin. French. Dutche, and English, Certen prophecies of
Paulo Grebner
vjd
Entred for his Copie, vnder the hand of the Bisshop of London and master warden Cawoodes handes / to yt / A Booke intytuled credible reportes from Ffraunce and Fflanaders / vjd

div.head:
Thomas orwin
See p. 553 .
div.p: Alowed vnto him for his copies by the consent of mistres Judson to whose Late husband the same are affirmed to haue belonged, these ffoure bookes ensuyng vppon condicon that none other person or persons haue an Interest to any of them ijs

list.item: 1. A compendious treatise or manuell of godly praiers printed before this for John Judson her late husband in 32do.
2. Item, the perfect patheway to salvacon conteyning sundry prayers before printed in 32do.
3. Item godly and devout meditacons and prayers very necessary for all men made by John Lydley printed before in. 32do.
4. Item, a, tablet for gentlewomen printed before in 32do.

div.head:
John Jackson /
Arnold Hatfeild
Edmond Bolyfant
div.p:
Entred vnto them for theire Copies, Institutionum, dialecticarum libri quatuor A
Johanne Sandersono Laucastrensi Anglo / &c Allowed under the h]andes of bothe the Wardens vjd

div.head: william wrighte ,
div.p: Entred for his copie vnder the h]andes of master Gravet and the wardens a ballad. Intituled, an excellent Dyttye made vppoa the arryvall of the kinge of Scottes with his ladye from Denmarke vppon maye daie laste with her Coronacon vjd /

div.head: R. Carre . /
div.p: Entered vnto him vnder the h]andes of the Bishop of London and master warden Cawoodes , a thinge in prose of the enterteynement of the Scottishe kinge and his Queene, at theire etntringe into Scotland with the Queenes coronacon. vjd . /

div.head: H. Care. /
div.p:
Entered vnto him vnder master Cawoodes hand, a ballad of the receauinge of the kinge of Scottes and Qneene
Anne
his
wife
into Lieth and Edenborogh vjd /

a

div.head: John wolf /
div.p: Entred vnto him for his Copies, vnder the handes of Master Hartwell, and master warden Cawood , theis ffoure seuerell Bookes followinge. / xviijd
Twooe to be translated out of Dutche /

list.item: 1 Theone of the which twoo bookes is intytuled Vcrgiffs Nit mein &c
2 The other intytuled Sterbens Kunst &c
3 The Thirde Booke intytuled / Alcoranus Ffrancisoanorum / to be printed in Latyn Efrench and Englishe. /

4 The fourthe intituled de quatuor hominis Novissimis to be printed in Latyn
Apparently by the fee to form but three English publications.]

william Nortons Consente. /

aucthore vnder the h]and of master warden.
Cawood
vjd

Entred vnto him for his Copie, A ballad intytuled, ffortune hath taken thee awaye my love, beinge the true dittie thereof. /Allowed vnder the handes of Master Doctor Staller , and master warden Cawood &c vjd
Entred for his Copie vnder the Bisshoppe of Londons hande and master Cawoodes , A ballad entituled The hangmans holyedaie vjd

Entred vnto him for his Copie, A booke called Ante
Sixtus , which is allowed as appeareth vnder the h]and of master Hartwell and master warden Cawoodes hand beinge to yt vjd

Entred vnto him for his Copie, A ballad vppon the deathe of a yonge man who was soddenly slayne by lightninge at Waltham, on whitsundaye last past
7 June] 1590 / with other strange thinges which happened on that Daye. / Allowed vnder the h]and of Doctor Stailer , and master warden Cawood his hand to yt vjd

div.head: Edward Venge /
div.p:
Entred for his copie vnder the h]andes of Doctor Stallard , and both the wardens a moste true discourse, Declaringe the Damnable lyfe and Deathe of one
Stube Preter , a highe Jermayne borne. with his execucon in the cyttye of Bedbur in Germanye the 31 of marche 1590 vjd

Entred for his copie vnder the h]andes of the Archbishop of Canterburye and master warden Cawood , a sermon vppon the wordes that
Josyah
the sonne of
Amor
sayd vnto Judah and Jerusalem, with other sermons therevnto annexed vjd /
Entred for his copie vnder the h]andes of the Bishop ot London , and master warden Newberye to be printed in English Le Manifeste De la Ffrance vjd /

div.head: Master Bysshop . Master newberie
div.p: Entred for their copie: A book entitled. ‘De Diuersis Ministrorum euangelij gradibus sicut &c Cui duo alij additi: alter ‘de honore qui debetur ecelesiarum pastoribus’. alter ‘de sacrilegijs et sacrilegorum poenis.’ Authore. Hadriano Sarajia Belga/: authorised by my Lord of Cantereury vjd

div.head:
Master Bisshop
Master new­berye /
div.p: Entred for their copie another booke entitled. Academiarum, quæ aliquando fuerunt, et hadie sunt in Europa, Catologus et enumeratio breuis. Authore. M.W vjd

Master Bisshop
master newberie
div.p:
Entred for their copie a sermon preached at Paules Crosse, on the 1.Cor.12 Chapter
verse 25. 26. 27. by Doctor James Deane of Christechurch in Oxeford vjd

Alowed vnto him for his copie the Ffrenche
Lyttleton sett forth by

div.head: Richard ffeild .
div.p: Alowed also vnto him: the Treatise of Christian Righteousnes which was Thomas Vautrolliers copie vjd

Entred for his copie a booke entitled.: Linguæ Latinæ exercitatio:

Auctore vjd

div.head: Thomas Gosson : See p. 549.
div.p: Alowed vnto him for his copies by consent of Thomas orwyn : those ffoure bookes whiche by consent of mistres Judson were alowed to the said Thomas Orwyn as apperithe in this booke the first of June last The which the said Thomas orwin dothe assigne and sett over vnto the sayd Thomas Gosson :

item.title: The compendious treatise of godly praiers

list.item: The perfect pathway to salvacon, in 32mo and 16mo

item.title: Devout meditacons necessarie for all men

div.p: Allowed vnto them for theire Copie / vnder the hande of the Bisshop of London , and bothe the Wardens, Tarltons newes out of Purgatorye, or a caskett full of pleasant conceiptes stuffed with delightfull devises and quaint myrthe as his humour maye a foorde to feede gentlemens fancies / vjd

div.head: John wolfe . /
div.p: Entered vnto him for his Copye to prynte, A booke intytuled, Englandes mourninge gowne, Aucthorised vnder the h]andes of Doctor Staller and bothe the wardens vjd . /

div.p: Entred to him for his copie, a ballad intituled, Blowe starche and potinge stickes / allowed vnder the hande of ye Bishop of London and master warden Cawoods hand beinge to yt vjd

div.head:
willim Holme
Junior.
div.p:
Entred for his copie vnder the h]and of Master Doctor Staller and the wardens A method very proffitable and spedie for the Readinge and vnderstandinge of the old and newe testament the one expoundinge another accordinge to ye sense and meaninge of our lord and saviour
Christ Jesus
vjd

div.head: To Thomas Butters widow /
div.p:
Entred vnto her for her copie vnder the h]andes of master Hartwell and master Cawood
a lamentable reporte of a greate tempeste of haile, that fell in Kent the 19 of June 1590 vjd .

div.head: Edward Aggas . /
div.p: Entered vnto him for his Copye vnder the h]andes of the Bishop of London and master warden Cawood , The sixe bookes of Politiques wrytten by Justus Lipsius , to be prynted in Englishe. / accordinge to the Frenche Copye vjd . /

div.head: John wolf .
div.p: Entred vnto him for his copie, the Rendringe of Sainct Denys with the takinge of iij traytors, in the presence chamber there, the takinge of Marcyllia and Grenoble for the kinge vjd /

div.p: Aucthorised vnto him vnder the hande of the Archbishopp of Canterburie and master Cawood , A Reconciliacon of all the pastours and ministers of the Churche of Englande vjd

div.p:
Entred for his copie vnder the h]andes of master Doctor Wood and master Cawood
The fight on ye sea. by 10. merchantes Shippes of London against. 12 Spanishe Gallies which assalted them in the straightes of Jublitor
i. e. Gibraltar where the Spaniardes with their gallies were spoyled &c with a Recitall of the newes of the ‘Abraham’ and the ‘Red Lyon’ with their fight against 10, gallies whomme they mightely spoiled vjd

Entred for his copie a ballad intitled a moste excellent dittye made vppon sundrye strange thinges which have latelye happened, and on sundrye horrible crymes lately committed, Allowed vnder the h]andes of Doctor Staller , and Master warden Cawood
vjd

div.p:
Entred vnto him for his Copie, a lettre from the Colledge of Sorbon
n
ee in Parris, to the Pope / Together with the generall confession of the pillers of the holly vnion. / and certen Epigramms. / Allowed vnder master Hartwelles hand and bothe the wardens vjd

i
e
u
r
De La Nouee

Parma
to aide the rebelles of the Leauge &c vjd

div.head: Richarde Pick­eringe . /
div.p:
Entred for his copie a ballad intituled wherein is shewen the greate abuses of this presents age shewinge how godlines modesty and vertuous life is vtterlie exiled and put to silence, and all manner of sinne and evill vices most highelye advanced &c Allowed vnder the handes of Doctor Staller and master warden Cawoodes
iiijd

che handes. vjd

div.p: * This initial may either refer to the remission at the end of this financial year of the Company, of certain fees for entries amounting to 10s 6d in the whole, which is recorded at I. 549; in which case it would stand for nihil: or more probaly it is that of Warden Newberry’s name; as at pp. 590, 614, and 647.

PROVYDED that Thomas Scarlet shall haue the workmanship of these bookes for master man as often as they shalbe printed Provyded Alwaies that if it be found that if any person hath a former Right to anye of these bookes (other then the said w. wright
Thomas Scarlet and John wolf ).That then the entrance shall not be preiudicall to any suche persons laufull clayme and Right

div.head: master John Harrison theelder. /
div.p:
Memorandum that the booke called. / Analisis Logica, quinque postremarum epistolarum Pauli / Videlicet, ad
Timotheum . prioris et posterioris. / Titum , Philemonem . Hebræos, Vna cum Scholiis, et observationibus locorum doctrina Aucthore
Johanne Piscatore . / Herbornæ, in 8o ys by warrant from master Coldock entred and set downe to be master John Harrison theelder his copie when it shall comme over from the marte[*], vnles it shall be founde to belonge to anye other person by aucthoritie of the lordes of her maiesties Counselle. / vjd
* i. e. from some book-fair on the Continent; probably either Frankfort or Leipsic.

no sum stated
The bond was made in master newberies name in the companies behalf: and yt is ordered that he shall put it ouer to Robert Robinson /

div.head: valentine Syms / 6d in le li.
div.p:
Graunted vnto him the printinge of master Latymers
sermons / but yt is referred to the consent of most voyces, whether he shall print yt for the stock, or generally for the parteners, or for the wholle companye that will laye on paper / prouided that he is to paie vjd in the li to theuse of the poore accordinge to the order vjd
Entred by warrant from the master and wardens vnder their handes. /

div.head: Adam Islip / See p, 621.
div.p:
Entred to him for his copie to printe for the companye. Chawcers
workes, by the consent of the wardens, and also by theappointment of Abell Jeffes to whome this copie was first entred /. and yf hereafter there be any Comentary or other thinge written vppon the same booke then the same Adam shall haue the offer of the same, either to take it, or refuse yt vjd

by Henry Smythe
Ecclesiasticus the 12. / the first. / ‘Remember thy maker in the Daies of thy youthe’ /

Prouided that the said Edward Aldee is to haue the workemanship of the printinge of this booke, and of one other sermon of the said Henry Smith for the said Cutbert burbye , as often, as this booke shalbe printed hereafter

div.p: Entred for his Copie vnder the h]andes of bothe the wardens a booke shewinge the miraculous Judgement of GOD showen in Herefordshire, where a mightie barne filled with Corne was consumed with fire begynninge last Christmas Eeue, and Duringe ffyftene Doyes after. /. vjd

div.p: Entred alsoe vnto him for his Copie a ballad of the same / which was but only vnder Master Cawoodes hande vjd

div.p:
Entred for his Copies vnder master warden Cawoodes hand ij bookes the One intituled a trew Discoverye of ij notable villanyes practised by One

the wyfe of
John Phillips

Dol Pope

div.p:
Entred for his copie in full Court holden this Day. A sermon viz. 1 Cor 9. 24. ‘So runne that ye may obteine’ / Jacob
s Ladder or the way to heaven vjd

Entred for his Copie vnder the handes of both the wardens, The Booke of secretes of
Albartus MAGNUS , of the vertues of herbes, stonnes and certen Beastes, Alsoe, a booke of the same author of the marvaylous thinges of the world and of certen effectes caused of certen beastes. beinge all in one Booke. &c vjd
